title: Thug jailed for 20 years after hitting man with a brick before pouring acid into his face
text:
Muhammed Al-Ali (pictured) has been jailed for 20 years for throwing acid at someone's face

A heartless thug left a man with 'devastating' injuries after hitting him with a brick and pouring acid on his face.

Muhammed Al-Ali was jailed for 20 years for throwing the corrosive liquid in the victim's face in the brutal attack.

The 24-year-old, of Barking, east London, was one of three men who arrived in a silver Lexus in nearby East Ham in February last year.

The victim was hit with a brick before the corrosive liquid was brought from the car and poured onto his face.

Heartbreaking images show scaly wounds and life-changing injuries to the left side of the victim's face and across both arms.

Innocent bystanders rushed to his aid and drenched him with water as he suffered catastrophic burns to his face, arms and torso.

Officers and paramedics rushed to the scene at around 4pm on February 12.

Heartbreaking images show scaly wounds and life-changing injuries to the left side of the victim's face and across both arms

Medics described his injuries as 'devastating' and the victim will require a number of procedures including skin grafts and the reconstruction of his eyelid.

Investigating officer DC Faye Cook, from Met Police, said: 'The injuries sustained by the victim were devastating.

'He has undergone and continues to undergo a long and painful schedule of treatment.

'I sincerely hope that he can find a measure of comfort in the sentence handed down today.'

All three attackers were identified from CCTV and forensic evidence, arrested and subsequently charged.

Sahme Mohammed (pictured), 28, of nearby East Ham, was found guilty of the same offences and will be sentenced in January

Al-Ali was found guilty of throwing a noxious substance with intent to maim, disfigure or cause GBH and GBH with intent.

He was sentenced to 20 years in prison at Snaresbrook Crown Court on Friday and told he would serve a minimum of 15 years behind bars.

Sahme Mohammed, 28, of nearby East Ham, was found guilty of the same offences and will be sentenced in January.

Mohammed was arrested on February 16 while Al-Ali was arrested ten days later.

Both were charged and remanded in custody until trial, which concluded on August 15.

A third man, 27, was arrested on February 16 last year on suspicion of GBH with intent.

He was also charged with throwing a noxious substance with intent to maim, disfigure or cause GBH, and GBH with intent.

But he died on June 29, before the trial.
description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Muhammed Al-Ali attacked a man in East Ham in February last year, hitting him with a brick before throwing corrosive acid on his face.
